Wagner Labor ArchiveElmer Holmes Bobst Library70 Washington Square South10th FloorNew York, NY 10012(212) 998-2630tamiment.wagner@nyu.eduThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2019-10-08T15:54:33Finding aid written in EnglishDescribing Archives: A Content Standard
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Daniel Lane Collection
Lane, Daniel
Lane, Patricia
AIA.086
1.75 linear feet in 1 oversize flat box and 1 folder in shared housing
1984-2013 Daniel Lane was the Chairman of the Nassau County Chapter of the Irish Northern Aid Committee (NORAID). In 2013 he acted as the Grand Marshall of the Glen Cove St. Patrick's Day Parade. The Daniel Lane Collection consists of textiles and ephemera collected by Lane documenting Irish American organizations, with emphasis on conflict in Northern Ireland in the late 1970s through the early 2000s. Materials from the Nassau County chapter of Irish Northern Aid and Irish American Society of Nassau, Suffolk, and Queens include newsletters, event programs, and items expressing opposition to the extradition and deportation of Joe Doherty, including buttons and a record for the song "Let Joe Go!" by Erin's Pride. The collection also includes St. Patrick's Day parade marshall sashes, a rubber bullet fired by the Royal Ulster Constabulary (RUC) on August 1, 1981 after the death of Kevin Lynch, and textiles created by Irish Republican prisoners in Long Kesh Detention Center for an Irish Northern Aid auction, including a flag signed by prisoners in Cage 22. Materials in English. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
Scope and Contents
The Daniel Lane Collection consists of textiles and ephemera collected by Lane documenting Irish American organizations, with emphasis on conflict in Northern Ireland in the late 1970s through the early 2000s. Materials from the Nassau County chapter of Irish Northern Aid and Irish American Society of Nassau, Suffolk, and Queens include newsletters, event programs, and items expressing opposition to the extradition and deportation of Joe Doherty, including buttons and a record for the song "Let Joe Go!" by Erin's Pride. The collection also includes St. Patrick's Day parade marshall sashes, a rubber bullet fired by the Royal Ulster Constabulary (RUC) on August 1, 1981 after the death of Kevin Lynch, and textiles created by Irish Republican prisoners in Long Kesh Detention Center for an Irish Northern Aid auction, including a flag signed by prisoners in Cage 22.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Danny Lane name were transferred to New York University in 2019 by Patricia Lane. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from repository. Please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Patricia Lane in June 2019; the accession number associated with this gift is 2019.116.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Daniel Lane Collection; AIA 086; box number; folder number or item identifier; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
At the time of accessioning materials were rehoused in archival boxes and folders, and described on the collection-level.
Biographical Note
Daniel Lane was the Chairman of the Nassau County Chapter of the Irish Northern Aid Committee (NORAID). In 2013 he acted as the Grand Marshall of the Glen Cove St. Patrick's Day Parade.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
